website_summaries.verdict: Livescribe's smart pen dominates the market for a reason: it's sleek, and accurate.
pros: The Echo smart pen transfers handwriting to editable text easily, making it a great tool for writers, students, and anyone else who prefers traditional pen and paper to typing
The pen also comes with a starter notepad, and a spare ink cartridge
cons: Not the most comfortable to hold
Transferring handwriting to editable text requires a Myscript download

customer_reviews.title: I was thrilled at the idea of taking notes with ...
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled at the idea of taking notes with this pen and then having them converted to digital text. The Livescribe website says that you can purchase MyScript software separately, and that will convert your notes to digital text. However, after I purchased the pen and tried to buy MyScript, I found out that the software is no longer available for purchase. I contacted Livescribe and they confirmed that they no longer offer a way to convert notes to digital text, even though their website still claims this is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Shanthi Nataraj

customer_reviews.title: Broke Again
customer_reviews.text: As others have written this is an excellent concept. I'm in research and use the pen to take notes when respondents are speaking. No need to capture word for word as the audio is captured. However, I am not considering a third purchase as the pens just do not last. The display wears out quickly and has a lot of glitches. Customer Support is non-existent. The pen will typically last just beyond the warranty leaving you with no claim for a replacement. I wish either a) they would improve the product or b) have a competitor create a better product.
customer_reviews.author: DLB

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software and support
customer_reviews.text: I had a different livescribe before, and I loved it! I'm an educator and providing extra examples for students combined with thinking processes is so important. However, the newest livescribe coupled with their newest desktop software is proving impossible for me to share the videos. So basically, it's useless to me. A $150 pen. I have submitted numerous support requests, and they just keep telling me the same directions over and over again. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gena

customer_reviews.title: TEXT TRANSCRIPTION NOT SUPPORTED
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy. The best feature of this pen which I used for nearly 10 years was the script to text transcription via third party supplier My Script. That product feature is no longer supported. You can no longer rely on Livescribe to take hand written notes and import into your office and productivity management suite. This effectively voids their current market value in the professional business world.
customer_reviews.author: John Runge

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you want a PC based smart pen that can find your handwritten notes without converting ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well if you want a PC based smart pen that can find your handwritten notes without converting to text. This is still the best solution and I have tried Neopen, Wacom Spark and Slate, as well as the Livesribe 3. The others are primarily phone or tablet based. I find my large screen PC monitor much easier to work with and I do not have to transcribe my notes to text to find things.Make sure to get a NEW pen with the improved life screen. beware of the older versions with the screens that fail after about 2 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: RMSCHUYLER

customer_reviews.title: Mac users - stay away. Desktop application will not work in Yosemite to El Capitan
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd Echo smarten. The pen itself is great. The problem is that the desktop software for Mac (Echo Desktop or older versions) is filled with bugs leading to almost immediate crashes. Spent several months working with Livescribe technical support, as this happens on two different Macs. Bottom line is that there is no fix available for the Mac version of the software and the only recommendation is to use a PC. So if you are a Windows based user, you should be OK and the pen will work well. If you use a Mac, your notes will never make it to a usable format on your desktop. Really a shame, because there are really no good alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: PCA

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give this a negative 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd SmartPen to purchase, and apparently it is a lemon. Initially, I had difficulties setting it up. Then after using it only 3 times, I got an error message, and it no longer works. If I could figure out how to contact the seller, I would because I would like a full refund. What a letdown - I had counted on using this to help my students in an online class - now I will look for something more high tech. I'm very disappointed - this had been a good product for me in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Has the same support options windows xp has, NONE. Unethical to sell in this condition
customer_reviews.text: Livescribe has stopped their contract with myscript, the company that transcribes your notes. In addition to that, livescribe "has decided that the best way to support international customers is through email," meaning if you aren't in Sweden or Korea, good luck getting fast support. Because of this, the pen does not function as advertised and I would say is unethical to sell in the way that livescribe and anoto are selling it. Disappointing purchase, I was a long time user of livescribe since high school and was excited to see how far they had come since. This was a sad sell out to discover. Just get the AEGIR
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Two of the two pens Amazon sent me did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I used an Echo pen at school and loved it. However, the first one Amazon sent me was defective; the OLED display did not work. And the second one Amazon sent me was defective as well; this time, in addition to the OLED display not working, the speaker did not work either. I think Amazon knows they're shipping defective products; the first thing the customer service agent did was to offer me a discount if I was willing to keep the defective pens and I've read this same comment several times.
customer_reviews.author: dpidduck

customer_reviews.title: If you have or are a student with ADHD I would recommend it to you
customer_reviews.text: This is so helpful, especially being a student with ADHD. If I wasnt 100% present because I was distracted, I can go back and listen, read notes, and add to my notes. Then I can go to my laptop and download it into the computer. If you have or are a student with ADHD I would recommend it to you. Make it apart of your high schoolers 504 or IEP plan.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Petersen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The first pen I purchased would not transfer data on the pen onto the Echo desk top. I worked through multiple links and online chats, then took it to the Geek Squad for help. They could not get it to work either. My laptop, which is new, could not recognize the pen. I returned the first pen and received a replacement. Went through the same steps and followed all the directions the company provided. Still it did not work so now I am returning the 2nd pen. The company only offers online support, no phone number on their website. Save yourself time and frustration - DO NOT buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: CUSTOMER

customer_reviews.title: Wish the connector wasn't so flakey - else it's a great pen
customer_reviews.text: The USB connector has broken on 2 previous pens and I'm not that rough with them. So this is my third pen. It picks up sound really well - even in an auditorium. It is very useful if you have to take minutes for a meeting and syncs with your PC so you can refer to images of handwritten notes in the special notebooks that Livescribe provides. I really like the pen, but a more robust implementation of the connector so it doesn't disappear into the pen would be most welcome - I have other USB devices with similar plugs and they don't deteriorate nearly as quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Hey

customer_reviews.title: Buy the cheaper Aegir model instead.
customer_reviews.text: This model is outdated. There is a newer, cheaper model, the Aegir Smartpen, that comes with a OS / Android app that allows you to sync your notes in all your devices including your desktop and upload them to cloud services such as Evernote, Google Drive, Dropbox and OneNote. I thought this model was the top of the line but I should‘ve gotten the cheaper Aegir with more advanced features. On top of it, the Aegir looks better, slimmer and comes in two colors.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Tome

customer_reviews.title: It's incredibly irritating and customer service seems to be pretty minimal. Also
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of this model and the third LiveScribe pen that I have bought for myself (not including the one for my daughter.) They generally work as advertised, and can be invaluable , HOWEVER, the batteries die after about two years (apparently irrespective of how much or little you use the device), and cannot be replaced. So, if you need it, plan to buy a new one every two years. It's incredibly irritating and customer service seems to be pretty minimal. Also, on the SKY, which my daughter has, the software tends to be very buggy. Unfortunately, there isn't much out there competing with it.
customer_reviews.author: FencerFrank

customer_reviews.title: A’s on all my midterms!  Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this smart pen enough. My community college loans them out to students with ADHD accommodations, so I was able to try one last semester and it was super helpful. The university I transferred to doesn’t have them yet, so I got my own. It’s great for catching those parts of the lecture you missed while you were zoning out.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Congdon

customer_reviews.title: I like to connect my pen and sync it up
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time user of LiveScribe pens. After my Pulse pen finally died after almost ten years, I upgraded to the Echo. I'm kind of old fashioned; I like to connect my pen and sync it up. Also, I like that this pen will record audio and let me review it based on the notes I take in the notebook. I chose this over other LiveScribe products because I don't need to have my phone or tablet with me to record. This will record the audio and then let me save an interactive PDF anywhere I want to review it later.
customer_reviews.author: K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Semester saver!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the BEST study tools I have ever used! So easy to use right out of the box! Make sure you use the notebooks with it to cross reference your lectures as your notes are written. I bought this half way through my semester and noticed a single letter grade up. Now, this isn't a magic wand or anything but using it the way intended definitely helped tremendously. My only complaint, if anything is that it's kind of big for a pen and did take a bit to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Kyah S.

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy, very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Endless problems with this product. Video and audio go out of synch for multi page "pen casts" Spend 30 minutes making a pen cast lecture and then on replay in pdf, watch page 4 audio being played with page 2 video. NOTHING that I can figure out fixes this.
customer_reviews.author: Almus Kenter

customer_reviews.title: after the display went bad on the previous two
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth smartpen, after the display went bad on the previous two. I stopped using livescribe 3 (app is bad, pen is worse) and returned the sky (pen may be smart, but Evernote is not. So they don't work). I went back to echo. In spite of the display problems, this is still the best model. Livescribe desktop, especially with my script (additional purchase), is very good.
customer_reviews.author: N.Dryl

customer_reviews.title: Setup worked -- I was able to set the date ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup worked -- I was able to set the date and time. A week later, did not function during first class. Pen is charged, screen works, but tapping the menu options on the notebook paper did not start a recording. Gave it 2 stars instead of 1 because I got a refund. The decent customer service is worth something. Maybe you will be luckier than I was.
customer_reviews.author: DGJerz

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Charging port Broke, no response from Livescribe. There are several testimonies here with similar problems. The pens are not designed to live past their warranty. This forces another purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L. Phillian

customer_reviews.title: Such a great geeky thing.
customer_reviews.text: This works easily and well. I just take notes in my notebook and it goes right to my computer when I plug in the pen. I also write well enough that the extra software is able to turn my writing into type most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ann

customer_reviews.title: ivescribe 2GB Echo Smartpen
customer_reviews.text: The software to translate into text is not available. You can find and download the file, but there are no activation codes available. RETURNED IT FOR REFUND
customer_reviews.author: Robert G Stone

customer_reviews.title: Do I love going back and transcribing the meeting
customer_reviews.text: I work as a Business Analyst and spend most of my days interviewing clients to gather requirements. This pen has made my job 100% easier than it ever was. I no longer have to struggle to keep up note taking with a fast talking marketing person or excitable sales person. I can guide the conversation and focus my attention that person by 'bookmarking' important parts and jotting down 1 word tags, allowing it to be much more free flowing and productive. Do I love going back and transcribing the meeting? Of course not. But I never miss the small details anymore. And clients can't tell me that 'I didn't ask for that' either, which is nice...
customer_reviews.author: Tutty

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I am a handicapped student and needed this pen to aid me in taking down my notes and studying, please DO NOT buy this product off of Amazon and just buy from the original site. I ordered this a few months back and the product was a complete waste of my time. The software and pen did not work properly no matter how many times I read the booklet or went on the actual site or did a factory reset. Amazons customer service was very helpful in trying to fix the situation but it still did not work properly. This was a complete disappointment and now I need to find alternatives to aid in taking down my notes.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: This product is crap. Livescribe used to be a very good product
customer_reviews.text: This product is crap. Livescribe used to be a very good product, but every "innovation" and new version just takes it further away from any reasonable assumption of user friendliness or usability. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Molina-paez

customer_reviews.title: It works as described, but its practical functionality is still limited.
customer_reviews.text: It works as described, in that you can find whatever is being said at the time of your writing--but this sometimes backfires. At times a lecturer will move on before you get done writing, thus you'll need to do multiple rewinds. If your sole purpose is to take notes, this is a really fantastic solution, but being limited to using only Livescribe notebooks hurts this product sometimes, as the costs start adding up substantially. I think the technology behind this is really cool, but being an early adopter in this field, just like many others, is still quite risky.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy- possible QA issues in the current model = dead pen
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Livescribe pens in the past (more GB, but same model) for work and have had no issues, but their quality must have slipped recently. This 2GB pen stopped working entirely after the first month or two. I thought it just needed charged but it won't respond to anything- completely dead. Reading other reviews, it looks like there may be a defect in the display. Unfortunate because it's such a great product... when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad desktop software
customer_reviews.text: The product is basically unusable now after they switch over to the new 'Echo" desktop. You can only export your note as a very low-quality pdf file to other note taking application. You will be better off just take note on a regular notebook and use a smartphone to capture it as a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping to use this to convert my writing to text to reduce my own transcribing. I am a therapist and take notes during sessions that then need to be typed into an electronic health record (EHR). I was so excited to save time. In order to get the feature to do what I needed I needed a code from the company. I called them a couple of times and left messages with the last one saying that if I did not hear from them I would return it. Well, that is what I did. I then purchased an iPad at a greater expense but now I save on paper too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Hennessey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device
customer_reviews.text: Livescribe captures the art of note-taking by exceptional recording and superb tech. The pen is easy to operate and the tech support and software are exceptional. My only critique is that I wish the ink would last longer than two months and write effectively when the paper is waxy. Other than this, I love my Livescibe!
customer_reviews.author: WOewok

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great investment for lecture classes. You don't need to write a lot it picks up every word the professor says and after downliafing the program on your device and registering your pen(which is in the guide they give you) you can play back the audio while the notes you took around the same time play. I have trouble staying ficused so it helps a lot! Will buy again if mine breaks which is highly unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Llacsa

customer_reviews.title: BEST work tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Wow- I have only used this thing for about a week and it has REVOLUTIONIZED my work life! If you have a poor memory and look back at your notes and ask yourself WTH was I writing? - this will be your best friend. I go back to my notes, tap on the portions I tapped on to relisten to details and it has really helped me to keep up with details.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne M. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: The battery on these pens have to be going dead by the time people are getting them, I started out with the pulse when the company first started. I had three and they are all dead. The echo isn't that much newer and it's batteries will be dead soon and they'll stop updates for it. The latest pens are not the same and they are less effective. The Pulse was the best and it should have been the only thing the company made.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! This pen comes in handy all the time at school. Records clearly even when sitting in the back of the classroom. This is a must have if you're in college.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: I'm done with these people
customer_reviews.text: Livescribe is a great concept and something I really need for work. I am not criticizing the basic concept, or, for the most part, the pen. What really bugs me is their refusal to upgrade their software to work with modern applications. Office 2013 has been out for over a year, and they still have not updated their app to work with OneNote 2013. WTH? Sure, they have a plethora of updates for Evernote, but what serious business person uses Evernote? Wake up livescribe! This is a product best suited for the business world. Make your products work for them!!! As for me, I've stowed the pen and am looking for something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Cory C. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to replace my first echo pen (my husband is still experimenting on it, so we'll see). It has lasted almost 2 years to the day. I didn't have issues with the screen. The charging port fell into the pen and it can no longer be plugged in to charge or transfer files. I'm in nursing school and use the pen to record lectures (each class has around 4-5 hours of lecture). It is uncomfortable to write with for that length of time, so I buy the 5 x 8 pads of paper and write out a few bullet points.
customer_reviews.author: MommyH

customer_reviews.title: Not a good gift unless you know....
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my husband he is a complete techy he took it out of the box and used maybe once.....now I think it is in a drawer somewhere......... Don't get for a tech guy unless you know they have a specific use for it or else you are wasting your money...
customer_reviews.author: Lakota

customer_reviews.title: The cap falls off easily
customer_reviews.text: I do love the echo pen. Unfortunately, the cap falls off easily and if you lose the cap, the ink can fall out. I got to a meeting and had no working pen. Easy answer is to get a case.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Aaronson

customer_reviews.title: The perfect pen!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to record meeting minutes. I love that I can go back to a point in the recording to review for clarity and that jumping back/forward is so simple. The recording is high quality. The software is intuitive and easy to use. I highly recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie H

customer_reviews.title: Must have for school!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this pen! She uses it exclusively for school and it's amazing to watch her use it. Hearing her professor giving the lecture as shes watching her notes from class is the coolest.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: This item needs to be updated from the Livescribe end
customer_reviews.text: I suspect that this item works well, but there is no way of knowing because although it says it will work with Mac OS 10.8 and higher, when you install it onto Catalina (10.15) the message tells you that the software needs to be updated on the Livescribe Echo side, so I was never able to use it. I have heard good things about the pen, so I hope they get this updated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't want to live without this amazing pen!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I'd do without this pen! I particularly love it when I take on-line webinars. I can do screen shots of the material while at the same time the pen records the audio. I no longer have to worry about missing the most important part of what was said--I just click back with the pen to the exact spot and hear what I missed. You can also share your notes and audio on-line. This is my second pen--I wore the first one out! Unfortunately, the only customer service is through chat rooms, so it takes 10 times longer to get info than if you could just talk to a real person about which pen to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Kraft "Anything Is Possible!"

customer_reviews.title: It's DOA
customer_reviews.text: We bought it. It sat for a couple of months because we just didn't get around to using it. When we finally tried, it was dead. No problem. We just need to charge it since it's been sitting for a while. NOPE! It doesn't work. We don't know if it's because it's been sitting or if it would have ever worked. Of course, being so far removed from purchase, I guess this will be a total loss. Lesson learned. I would recommend staying away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never miss a word in class
customer_reviews.text: Ability to record without having to rely on the connection & baterry life on your phone is the most reliable version of a smart pen
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Great Product I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Echo pen from Live scribe for my first two years at my community college, expecting that it would allow me to get much more out of lectures and improve my grades. I bought Live scribe's pen, multiple notebooks, and 3-D recording headphones. And I must say that I love this item because It does it's job right,it is very helpful and handy, and also it makes it so easy to take notes in class since I do not write very fast because of my learning disability. So Thank You Live Scribe for making such a great product for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: carebear5577

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pen, Horrible Software for Syncing
customer_reviews.text: The pen itself works well. It's a little bulky, kind of like a sharpie marker. If you have a Mac, be warned. The software doesn't work well. It locks up on my Macbook Pro all the time. When I contacted support, I was told to find a Windows machine to sync the pen to. Then they proceeded to tell me that I should reinstall the OS. If you're running a Mac, be prepared for a lot of pointing the finger from their support department and links to knowledge base articles. They will blame everything except the horrible software that comes with the pen.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E

customer_reviews.title: Not for teaching
customer_reviews.text: Item worked as indicated and was easy to use however it did not clearly indicate recordings can only be played back if listener installs Echo software. I feel this is misrepresentation. I wanted to make short videos for remote instructional purposes but students could not view or listen to them without proper software. I would not be able to show them in school either, unless the school agreed to install the software (teachers are not given permission to install any software on school equipment). I returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: amz customer

customer_reviews.title: This dumb pen is not worth $
customer_reviews.text: This dumb pen is not worth $.25, much less the $100 bucks they want to rip off. First, the text conversion is non-exiswten. Second; THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT FROM dead-SCRIBE. I tried 5 times to contact them-- their software is abominable. This is essentially a company selling a 19'th century product (a notebook & pen) who has not taken note that it is the 21'st century now-- DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Beemer buddy

customer_reviews.title: Great smart pen!
customer_reviews.text: Great smart pen! I bought this to replace a Livescribe 3 pen which only lasted a year before it stopped charging. This one is cheaper and is a much better product, and the pen records the audio so you don't need to use the memory on your phone or tablet to so. I would highly recommend this pen to any student.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for a special education teacher
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pen for my classroom students. I’m a special ed teacher. I’m able to watch how they are forming the letters and they like to read and listen to themselves read. It’s a way to monitor how their reading is improving.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Mako

customer_reviews.title: Grade saver for students
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pen throughout college as a loaner- and recently decided to invest in my own. Recording quality is excellent, and it's been a life saver to my academic career. Especially with the ability to link playback to the notes directly. As a hearing impaired person this gives me the ability to replay later the specific parts of the lecture that I couldn't hear.
customer_reviews.author: JSloan

customer_reviews.title: The pen died and the company did not stand behind its product
customer_reviews.text: The pen died after a little over one year of slight to moderate use. I advised the company and followed their suggestions to attempt to get it to work to no avail. The pen was useless and the livescribe pads I had purchased are similarly useless except for regular note taking. The pen was likely out of warranty but the pen should last longer than it did. The company does not stand behind its product. I would not recommend paying money for this pen. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: The pen records and writes nice. But the echo desktop software is terrible along ...
customer_reviews.text: The pen records and writes nice. But the echo desktop software is terrible along with their online chat. The echo desktop won't recognize my pen there for I can't register it and can't get any of my lectures off of it. I'm going on 4 days now of a conversation with 15 hour for them to respond where they are telling me to try things that I have already told them that I tried.
customer_reviews.author: SARA N WILD

customer_reviews.title: Help you when people talk and fast
customer_reviews.text: I purchased item because I had the Generation 1 and my generation one finally went out so this product to me works perfect are Virgos and me taking notes for my VP and directors
customer_reviews.author: marcells

customer_reviews.title: Really Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The description stated you could convert audio to text and after reading the instructions (limited) and googling, I never was able to perform that function.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Keyes

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best investment that I've made yet as far as school ...
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with note taking during my lecture classes. When I try to take notes, I end up missing whatever is being discussed as I'm writing down my information. This has been the best investment that I've made yet as far as school goes. I can listen and interact in my classes with my full attention making a mark on the note page occasionally to indicate something important. Later I can go back and retrieve any information that I need as I need it. I highly recommend this for anyone who struggles with note taking or multi-tasking in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Porter

customer_reviews.title: Ink wiggles-annoying sound
customer_reviews.text: I had a school issued pen. Loved it! perfect! But this one I bought isn't perfect. The cap gets stuck and it's a struggle to remove it. But most importantly my ink wiggles when I write fast (take notes in class). When I listen to my recording, I can hear the wiggling noise loud and clear which is super distracting and makes it hard to hear the words that I recorded. My advice would be to test out your pen immediately and write fast.
customer_reviews.author: LoLo T

customer_reviews.title: Love this! I use it during board meetings so ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I use it during board meetings so that I get the actual voice and wording if I need to go back later. Once loaded on your computer, you can actually hear the voices as you see the writing appeat on the pages. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Echo Smart Pens
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a lot of these for students and students that really take advantage of the pens absolutely love them. The draw back on these pens is they barely live to their warranty date IF they make it to the end of their warranty. I haven't had any luck getting them replaced through Livescribe either. The light on the screen usually goes out first and you can't read the screen on them. Also, if one goes dead you will have to spend a lot of time having Livescribe talk you through getting your information downloaded from the pen.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel G Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Great product idea, durability could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 1.5 years. As others have reported, my LED screen isn't working now and there's a crack in the pen from wear and tear. This product has great potential but could benefit from a little better manufacturer. I am looking to get a replacement but was sad to see there aren't any product refreshes or any new products like the echo that don't have their own issues If Livescribe was like Apple, and provided better service for issues, higher quality products, or innovations on the same products, I'd be a happier customer and rate this higher.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: LIVESCRIBE IS CRAP
customer_reviews.text: its a piece of crap. DONT buy this. I bought a 2gb echo pen for my daughter based on a recommendation of a counselor. They bought the same exact pen. Neither one has worked from day 1!!! There is no phone number to call, you have to live chat, but they keep wanting you to plug it in and unplug etc to no avail even though it has been explained numerous times that this has been done before. They wont refund for their defective product. NEVER EVER buy one of these. This company is a fraud.
customer_reviews.author: skin2win!!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I need to record while in class and this pen allows me to do just that without my other classmates knowing that I am recording. the professor knows and approves of the use. You can listen to the lesson at any point when used with the Livescribe notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Philly

customer_reviews.title: Not new as described
customer_reviews.text: This pen was not as described to be new and also did not arrive as identified. It was delayed and when it arrived, the pen and box were clearly used and what should have been in the box was not. Not as described.
customer_reviews.author: D. Per

customer_reviews.title: Great technology, but either screen isn't working or the thing isn't charging.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the technology. LOVE LOVE LOVE. But after very little use, it stopped responding to a charge. I now wonder if the display just isn't working....so I think it's not working. Maybe the thing works and I just can't tell due to no display! What a mess. Great technology, but for 6 months I've wondered if I should just throw it away. I also had the older version. It worked great but eventually stopped charging (I thought.) I wonder if that was just a display issue as well.
customer_reviews.author: dinghypursuits

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - synching files to MAC does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of money on this pen only to find out there are issues with the software not recognizing the pen if you have a Mac. I've spent time with support trying all kinds of things to fix the problem but nothing has worked. So the pen eventually will be full of recordings that I cannot archive - and it will be a useless paperweight! DO NOT BUY! They claim it's a problem with High Sierra OS.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great.... til the light stops working and you cannot read the screen
customer_reviews.text: The pen works great, For a while. But then the light on the pen fails to work and you cannot tell whether it is charged or not, or on or off. If you go into a totally dark room you can barely see the screen. But not enough to know what is going on with the pen.The warranty is merely 6 months. Add to this the investment in the special books and you have one large expense for a poorly designed item which fails. Greatly dissappointed. Huge thread here of dissatisfied customers with same issue. [...]
customer_reviews.author: empower

customer_reviews.title: So great, I may get another one!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I think anyone going to school should have one. I even bought one for my high school student. He has autism and I wish I had bought this for him sooner. Makes note taking so much nicer or you can just record your lecture and everything goes right onto your computer when you plug it in. So nice.
customer_reviews.author: melinda

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used this pen before when my school loaned it to me for classes and finally decided to buy it. the pen itself is good, but the software is terrible. it says it works with PDF live which I purchased and Evernote, but nothing is syncing like it's supposed too. if you need for basic notes it's a solid product, but anything else...No!!
customer_reviews.author: mstrouble_xo

customer_reviews.title: That makes this product not very useful.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my dyslexic child to be able to record a teachers lecture and then be transcribed to notes. What is not clearly stated in the product description is that you must send the audio file to a third party and for ta fee they will transcribe it and the turn around time is 48 hours. That makes this product not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Bladenboro

customer_reviews.title: I am glad this was still available
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has used this model for years, I am glad this was still available. I am primarily on Linux but my laptop still runs Windows Vista (I won't upgrade to any higher version of Windows) and I can enjoy the features of coordinating my notes with the recording. Amazing pen.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: I FEEL SCAMMED
customer_reviews.text: it ran out of ink 1/2 way through the first page...the least they could have done is sent me one with enough ink to decide whether or not I liked it enough to buy refill ink
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: "Echo desktop does not support the connected smart pen; you can leave the smartpen connected to ...
customer_reviews.text: both pens don't work and both display the same error message: "Echo desktop does not support the connected smart pen; you can leave the smartpen connected to charge it. " Found out this past weekend when visiting kids at college. would have requested a return sooner except kids were/are away at college.
customer_reviews.author: C2

customer_reviews.title: Great helpful and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works great, and wish I ordered it sooner. So handy and helpful in school, work meeting, and to hold accountability in other departments.
customer_reviews.author: candice

customer_reviews.title: I love this pen for making a digital copy of my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen for making a digital copy of my notes. This is my second one and so far so good. Before this I had the sky which if you read the reviews I had the same problem of the display stop working making the pen unusable.
customer_reviews.author: blake foust

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease at which I can take and record notes. The only thing I wish was that there was a remote foot control for playback for transcribing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and works as advertised, no contact with tech support needed yet
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Mac Lacking
customer_reviews.text: The pen itself is a great product... I was debating with the more expensive (newer) Sky version, but didn't want to deal with the complexities, or getting locked into a subscription (Evernote Premium) for it's usage. The Pen works very well, audio capture is clean even in a large room, simplicity is awesome, and the actual ink capture is very accurate. But my efforts to sort and copy the notes or Pencasts to my iPad for review have been very tricky. Seems that the development of the Pencast iPad app has stalled - they should really pick that back up...
customer_reviews.author: -jb-

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed with how this product's quality turned out to be
customer_reviews.text: After owning this product for nearly a month, it stopped working! No matter what you wrote or attempted to touch on the special papers, it failed to read or even respond/record for than matter. I'm very disappointed with how this product's quality turned out to be. I was in my nursing program taking notes on cardiology lecture content when it abruptly gave out. Thank you, Echo Smartpen, I really needed you.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: As with all the other negative reviews... the display died just over two years after purchase. An absolute piece of crap -- and the customer support is NON-EXISTENT. I hope they go out of business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dyslexics
customer_reviews.text: This pen is great for people who have trouble taking notes quickly. It records the lecture as you take notes (or draw), and then afterwards, when you put the pen on the place where you took notes, it replays the lecture starting from that point in the lecture. Ingenious. I also used it to record my mother's telling me about her youth as we looked through her photo albums - now I not only have the stories recorded, but I have it in her voice!
customer_reviews.author: schooling mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Livescribe Echo Smarten. I received the first one as a gift from my son 8 years ago and after cracking it after a drop to the floor, it still worked perfectly. What finally did the pen in was the LED readout died so I could no longer tell whether or not it was on. 8 years later and the pen is pretty much exactly the same. I have keep all my notes all these years on my computer and am able to bring up notes within minutes. The computer interface is excellent on both my Mac and my PC. This is a great device...
customer_reviews.author: Jiff

customer_reviews.title: Livescribe Smartpen
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as the main 13th Anniversary gift for my husband, and he truly loves this pen. And is always finding new was to use this pen. He has tried to get in touch with the Help Support, and hasn't heard back from them. This is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Maris

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and helpful for classes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it for her classes. The batteries are hard to find, but it is very cool and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dona

customer_reviews.title: It died
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the pen about 1 year ago. I LOVED it, until it died. After using it for 11 months, i just recently got Error 31 message. I did research and it appears many people have had this problem. I contacted the company and basically the pen is dead. I lost notes I've taken and while it is under warranty, it will take 2 weeks for it to come back into stock before they can mail it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Enna67

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product - doesn’t work well with Macs
customer_reviews.text: I hate this pen. It rarely downloads to my Mac and when it does, I can’t find anything in my searches. It’s completely useless. I’ve had two of these and neither worked with the software. It’s just a pricey, uncomfortable pen but hat requires expensive notebooks. Save your money and wait til something better comes along.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use and was a life saver in my lecture classes. A good buy for people who are slow wrighter like my self. It made it easy to go back and listen to the recording and take better notes.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me as a college student
customer_reviews.text: The product functions as it was intended to and the technology is really cool, but it did not work for me as a college student. I got tired of having to remember to start and stop the recording between each break in lecture. Also, a lot of my classes have lab, so I would have to carry regular paper and pencil anyway and switch between the live scribe stuff and the regular paper. That was the biggest pain. I tried it for about 2.5 months in 2 classes twice a week before I gave up on it. I only listened to one recording again from that entire time, so I decided to put it away in a drawer somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works great and really picks up the ambient audio.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works great and really picks up the ambient audio. Bought the wired version and it has plenty of capacity. Very happy I bought it with the Livescribe Echo 3D High-Quality Stereo Recording Headset (AAA-00020) - they work very well together and very good audio quality recording, including for conference calls when I have the call on speakerphone.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Reviewer NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for educational classes
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my classes at college. It worked great. I have no use for it now.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Already Broken!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Pen less than a month ago for school, and it's already broken! Not only does it not work now, but all the recordings I used with it - in the background you could hear the pen writing over top of my teachers voice! Absolutely junk! I bought this because of the good ratings, however - my product is completely broken!
customer_reviews.author: eNkrypt

customer_reviews.title: I love this unit
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. It is not WiFi, so I have to plug in a USB cord...which is fine :) I use it for work, journaling, note taking, all in separate​ notebooks and kept in digital notebooks on your laptop or pc.
customer_reviews.author: John Consumer

customer_reviews.title: He has perfect auditory recall
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son who is in graduate school and a slow note-taker. He has perfect auditory recall, but when you need to turn in some notes, this makes it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work or school when taking notes and not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years! Perfect for work or school when taking notes and not to worry about missing anything since you can always play back and focus on LISTENING and not the note taking. Life saver!!
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Musilli

customer_reviews.title: No syncing via WIFI
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was loaned a Livescribe at college. She liked it so we purchased this one. It works great but she is disappointed because it doesn't have wifi. Her other one could be synced via wifi and this one you have to connect. My response...she won't die.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pen for meetings
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my training on the job, meetings, and it would be excellent for students to take notes.
customer_reviews.author: Marydee Valdez

customer_reviews.title: echo pen stores all the data in the pen even after you download
customer_reviews.text: I have the echo pen. I like it. Recently my computer crashed. I got a new one and download the software. After endless emails and no help from Livescribe I discovered on my own that if you connect the pen to the computer it downloads all the data you stored. Why couldn't they tell me that?
customer_reviews.author: Karen Quinn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The battery died and it wouldn't let me charge it
customer_reviews.author: MommaRee

customer_reviews.title: Record without writing
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it record as you are writing and not writing notes on the tablet
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: It is good for particular uses
customer_reviews.text: It is good for particular uses, like if you want to record. Consider the eraseable notebooks like Zohulu instead for other projects. It’s a less expensive alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

product_meta.title: Livescribe 2GB Echo Smartpen
product_meta.description: Pattern Name:SingleTake the stress out of tests and meetings with an Echo smartpen from Livescribe. Record everything you hear, say and write, while linking your audio recordings to your notes. Quickly replay audio from your Livescribe paper, a computer, or a mobile device - all with a simple tap on your handwritten notes. It's never been easier to take notes and stay organized.
feature_bullets: Record everything you write and hear so you'll never miss a word
Replay your meetings or lectures simply by tapping on your notes
Saves notes and audio recordings to your computer. Length = 6.18 inches
Comes with Echo Desktop software for Mac or Windows (download), Starter Notebook (50 pages), 2 ink cartridges(one in the pen and one in the box) & 1 smartpen cap
Mac System Requirements- Mac OS X 10.8.5 and above. Windows System Requirements-Windows 7 or Windows 8 and above. Micro USB cable for charging and data transfer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars876 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
